page.title: 03HISTORY 1931 - 1985
page.content: In 1931 the lord of the manor,Sir Samuuel Scott,M.P.for Marylebone from 1898 till 1922, sold the estate of 1328 acres and almost the whole village.Only the church,the vicarage and the Reindeer Inn were not included in the auction.There were 6 farms at that time rented from the Scotts by tenant farmers.The Chapman family were involved in most of them as well as the Mill from the mid 19th century till 1922 when the Owens entered the scene.Some of the estate workers left with the Scotts but those who stayed were able to buy their homes and their descendents form the nucleus of the village today.There is considerable longeavity in Westbury so that it is possible to talk to inhabitants who spent their childhood in manorial days and whose parents worked for the lord of the manor.
